question: In context with the recent modification done in the foreign direct investment (FDI) policy of India, the entity of which country should invest only under the government route?
option4: All countries sharing land border with India
answer: All countries sharing land border with India
explanation:
The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) has recently released a press note regarding modification done in the Foreign direct investment (FDI) policy of India, as a part of its effort to restrict take-over of Indian companies amid Covid-19 pandemic. 
As per the new changes, an entity of a country which shares a land border with India can invest only under the government route, which means the entities can invest only after receiving the approval of the Indian Government. Prior to this, investments from Pakistan and Bangladesh were only under Government route.
